channel.title: Damage
channel.description: Well, i think it isn't possible in a 317, or maybe even in a 508+, but is it possible that on a place that u get damage when there is NOT the item: "fire" on the ground somewhere around you. Is that possible? And that u get damage if u DON'T eat in a minute or osmething.

item.description:

Oh, but now i still don’t understand EXACTLY where to add the codes.

item.title: Damage
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

a method is storing a piece of code under a name so you can call it later. for example, you call your dog lou so you can call him later. a void is just a kind of a method, and you write it like this:

public void lou() {
}

and if you want to call it later so you can use the code in it you do

lou();

and it will automatically work

item.title: Damage
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

ahhhh why didn’t you say so?!?!?!?!?! well i can’t make it so that if you’re more than 4 times away from a fire you die but i can make a fire timer. for example, if you don’t light a fire for 30 seconds you get hit by damage. really the objects should be easy but the problem is i probably do not know the proper syntax to use. so here’s a timer for fires:
declare this int:

public int firetimer = 0;

add this in your process:

if(firetimer > 0) {
firetimer -= 1;
}
if(firetimer == 0) {
firetimer = 30;
int hitdmg = misc.random(10);
currentHealth -= hitdmg;
sM("You recieved "+hitdmg+" to your hitpoints!");
			if ((itemUsed == 590) && (useWith == 1513)) {
				if (playerLevel[11] >= 75) {
					deleteItem(1513, getItemSlot(1513), 1);
makeGlobalObject(absX,absY, 2732, 0, 10);
					addSkillXP(1200, 11);
sM("You attempt to light the logs.");
sM("The fire catches and the logs begin to burn.");
firetimer = 30;
resetWC();

				} else {
					sM("You need a firemaking level of 75 to burn magic logs.");
				}
			}

there. not perfect, but here’s how it is:

if you start making a magic log fire, you’ll set your timer to 30. if timer reaches 0, it will deal a random number from 1 to 10, and will send a message saying “you recieve “+hitdmg+” damage to your hitpoints!”. i can’t really make it check right now because my server files are screwed but this should work.

Read full topic

item.title: Damage
item.dc:creator: @xweetok599 xweetok599
item.description:
@xweetok599 wrote:

Well, u didn’t understand, here is a good explentation:

I want to make a system for the lumbridge swap, where you have to make a fire to stay alive. If you are more then 4 tiles away from a fire for more then 30 seconds, you get hit by X damage. Also, if you do not eat for a minute, you also get hit by X damage.

Read full topic

item.title: Damage
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

okay i really don’t understand, but here’s something you can try:

  1. declare a new int
public int firedamage = 0;
  1. search for public boolean isInWilderness and add this right above it:
	public boolean isInFire(int coordX, int coordY, int Type) {
		if ((coordY == YYYY) && (coordY == YYYY2) && (coordX == XXXX) && (coordX == XXXX2)) {
			return true;
		}
	}

replace coords with where you want the damage to be. for example if i want people to be damaged at jad then i’ll replace co-ords with jad co-ords.

  1. search for public boolean process() {
  2. add under it this:
if(isInFire && firedamage > 0) {
firedamage -= 1;
}
if(isInFire && firedamage == 0) {
sM("you burn in the fire!");
currentHealth -= misc.random(10);
firedamage = 10;
}

that should do it.

this just makes it so that if you’re standing in the area of “isInFire” it would damage you.

idk though that’s currently what i can provide because i’m on my friend’s comp :\

Read full topic

item.title: Damage
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

So easy. Use the system timer to allow 15 seconds and then check for a fire within 3 squares of your character, and if theirs not one then apply damage.
